qas.question: When did cotton begin to be commercially grown in Egypt?
What French businessman convinced the ruler of Egypt to grow cotton for the French market?
Who was ruler of Egypt in the 1820s?
How high had cotton revenues risen by the time of the American Civil War?
How many bales of cotton were produced by Egypt by 1903?
When did cotton begin to be commercially grown in the US?
What French businessman convinced the ruler of Egypt to grow cotton for the US market?
Who was ruler of Egypt in 1903?
How high had cotton revenues risen by the time of the French Civil War?
How many bales of cotton were produced by Egypt by 1820?

context: Though known since antiquity the commercial growing of cotton in Egypt only started in <a0_0><b5_0>1820's<b5_0/>,<a0_0/> following a Frenchman, by the name of <a1_0><b6_0>M. Jumel<b6_0/><a1_0/>, propositioning the then ruler, <b7_0>Mohamed Ali Pasha<b7_0/>, that he could earn a substantial income by growing an extra-long staple Maho (Barbadence) cotton, in Lower Egypt, for the French market. <a2_0>Mohamed Ali Pasha<a2_0/> accepted the proposition and granted himself the monopoly on the sale and export of cotton in Egypt; and later dictated cotton should be grown in preference to other crops. By the time of the American Civil war annual exports had reached $16 million (120,000 bales), which rose to <a3_0><b8_0>$56 million<b8_0/><a3_0/> by 1864, primarily due to the loss of the Confederate supply on the world market. Exports continued to grow even after the reintroduction of US cotton, produced now by a paid workforce, and Egyptian exports reached <a4_0><b9_0>1.2 million bales a year<b9_0/><a4_0/> by 1903.
